conclusion: Each wooden block has mass m, total mass of the system is 4m.
The horizontal surface is smooth, the spring is mass-less, and the only horizontal interaction is static friction at contact surfaces.
An external horizontal force F is applied to block B, causing all blocks to move together with common acceleration a.
Using Newton's 2nd law for the whole system, F = 4ma, hence a = F / (4m).
Consider block D alone, it only touches block C and receives horizontal force from static friction.
The static friction force on D must provide acceleration a, hence f_static on D = ma = F / 4.
The direction of static friction force on D is to the right.
The static-friction force acting on block D has magnitude F‚ÅÑ4 and points to the right.
